intro: Litsea bancana, commonly known as the Philippine laurier or white flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its fragrant foliage and striking floral display. Litsea bancana is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
